name: medium_bulk_search
description: Search multiple topics on Medium in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling medium_search multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all queries as a single comma-separated string. Example: 'machine learning,startup advice,productivity tips'.

detailSteps.code: const results = []; const articles = document.querySelectorAll('article, [data-testid="postPreview"], div[class*="postArticle"]'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(articles.length, 5); i++) { const el = articles[i]; const titleEl = el.querySelector('h2, h3, [class*="title"]'); const authorEl = el.querySelector('a[data-testid="authorName"], a[rel="author"], [class*="author"] a'); const clapsEl = el.querySelector('[class*="clap"] span, button[data-testid="clap"] span'); const dateEl = el.querySelector('time, span[class*="date"]'); const readTimeEl = el.querySelector('[class*="readingTime"], span[class*="read-time"]'); const linkEl = el.querySelector('a[href*="/p/"], h2 a, h3 a'); results.push({ title: titleEl ? titleEl.textContent.trim() : '', author: authorEl ? authorEl.textContent.trim() : '', claps: clapsEl ? clapsEl.textContent.trim() : '', date: dateEl ? (dateEl.getAttribute('datetime') || dateEl.textContent.trim()) : '', read_time: readTimeEl ? readTimeEl.textContent.trim() : '', url: linkEl ? linkEl.href : '' }); } const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search); return { query: params.get('q') || '', result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
